thread.title: Sunderland's Papy Djilobodji facing FA ban after appearing to strike West Brom midfielder Darren Fletcher
thread.title_full: Sunderland's Papy Djilobodji facing FA ban after appearing to strike West Brom midfielder Darren Fletcher

author: James Nursey
title: Sunderland's Papy Djilobodji facing FA ban after appearing to strike West Brom midfielder Darren Fletcher
text:
Sport Sunderland's Papy Djilobodji facing FA ban after appearing to strike West Brom midfielder Darren Fletcher The incident went unseen by match officials at the Hawthorns but retrospective action is likely to be taken Share Fletcher and Djilobodji argue during Saturday's match (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Bottom club Sunderland face more woe with defender Papy Djilobodji facing an FA rap. 
David Moyes' men are already without eight players injured and three players at the Africa Cup of Nations. 
Now Djilobodji faces likely retrospective punishment from the authorities after appearing to punch Darren Fletcher in the 2-0 loss at West Brom. 
The 85th-minute incident was missed by referee Craig Pawson and the Black Cats defender was not booked. 
But Match of the Day footage showed Djilobodji swinging at Albion captain Fletcher. Djilobodji appeared to punch Fletcher during Sunderland's loss to West Brom (Photo: BBC) The incident went unseen by officials but not by the TV cameras (Photo: BBC) 
The FA are now set to intervene if Pawson confirms he missed the incident at the time. 
It would then go before the FA's incident review panel of three ex-professional referees. 
Djilobodji could be banned for up to three matches if found guilty of violent conduct. View gallery 
Sunderland return to action on Tuesday January 31 at home to Spurs before visiting Crystal Palace and hosting Southampton. 
It is a potential fresh headache for Moyes already missing Wahbi Khazri, Lamine Kone and Didier Ndong at AFCON with Tunisia, Ivory Coast and Gabon respectively. 
While key men like Lee Cattermole, Jan Kirchhoff, Jordan Pickford and Duncan Watmore are sidelined injured. poll loading Will Sunderland secure Premier League survival this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
